page.title: 06Farming (continued)
page.content:
Newlandburn Farm.
Originally it was a fruit farm growing mostly plums (the summers must have been warmer then!). Today barley is the main crop. The barley is dried in a huge diesel-powered drying machine and sent to the Pencaitland distillery for whisky making. One field is used grazing pasture. Two huge sheds house 18,000 free range hens for egg production.The eggs are hatched and Ross Poultry buy the chicks.The farm is managed by John Ray and worked from Earlston.
The other farms in the district are very similar.
